title: NASA readies SLS moon rocket for return to Vehicle Assembly Building
summary: Ground teams moved a diesel-powered crawler-transporter underneath the Space Launch System moon rocket Sunday on pad 39B at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center, preparing the towering launcher for a return to the Vehicle Assembly Building for repairs. The rollback to the hangar could begin as soon as Monday afternoon.

title: Historic Axiom-1 mission set for return from ISS as Crew-4 prepares for launch
summary: The first all-private astronaut mission to visit the International Space Station (ISS), Axiom-1, is set for its return to Earth. Crew Dragon Endeavour is due to undock from the station’s Node 2 zenith (or space-facing) docking port at around 00:55 UTC Monday (8:55 PM EDT Sunday), with reentry and landing off the coast of Florida currently targeted for 17:06 UTC Monday (1:06 PM EDT).

title: China to conduct asteroid deflection test around 2025
summary: China will aim to change the trajectory of a potentially threatening asteroid with a kinetic impactor test as part of plans for a planetary defense system.

title: Space startups argue for more agile business models
summary: Companies pursuing emerging technologies are getting funding from venture investors but also are looking for U.S. government support

title: SpaceX again waves off return of Axiom crew mission
summary: With persistent high winds off the Florida coast, SpaceX on Saturday again waved off the undocking and return to Earth of a Dragon crew capsule from the International Space Station with four private astronauts. The decision delays the Axiom crew’s departure until no earlier than Sunday night, with splashdown Monday afternoon.

title: Iridium and General Dynamics submit joint bid for Space Development Agency contract
summary: Communications satellite operator Iridum and General Dynamics Mission Systems submitted a joint bid to operate and manage the Space Development Agency’s low Earth orbit constellation.

title: NASA space technology programs face “constraining” budget
summary: A flat budget for NASA’s space technology programs is “very constraining” for the agency as it faces tough decisions about what efforts it can fund and at what amounts.

title: Copernic Space welcomes Kevin O’Connell to advisory board
summary: Copernic Space, the latest company to bring Kevin O’Connell onto its advisory board, is unlike other ventures the former director of the U.S. Office of Space Commerce has joined.

title: Space Force radar that monitors low Earth orbit to feed data directly to cloud platform
summary: Data from the Space Fence radar that tracks objects in low Earth orbit can now be accessed through the Unified Data Library

title: Japan’s ispace negotiating first commercial moon landing insurance
summary: Japanese lunar lander developer ispace said April 21 it is negotiating the world’s first insurance coverage for a commercial mission to the moon’s surface.
